_data.title: Hello World!
_data.discrete: type[log, articulation, essay, documentation, comment, tutorial]

children.value: This is neither my first blog nor the first time I am writing this particular text. Yet it is the first time that I am managing through my own interface. I have some sort of obsession with re-making/wording things I have done before. I have been amazed by the creativity of human beings, as a result of this, I always wanted to create things myself as well. Unfortunately, most of the time I lost in the process. Thus I have some sort of reasoning to backtrace my mistakes and sculpt them to better.

Lately, I have completed my master's thesis. I have the same concerns that I have mentioned before, I have worked and learned a lot and I have had to pin down what I have gained from the process. Firstly, I noticed that I like writing, and how important writing is in rendering and evaluating ideas. Secondly the difference between generating and representing ideas in a way to transpose a resonance on other minds. One of my problems (and I often see on other people too) is being lost in the process. I see that writing is one of the fastest and most convenient ways to concretize and convey ideas to evaluate or tinker at a later point. It could either work as external memory, along with managing the knowledge and memories. Therefore, I consider writing is one of the mediums through that I could develop myself, produce, and contribute to humankind. This is one of the reasons that I aimed to elaborate on why I have started this blog.

This blog has a few objectives, one is, as I have told before to rasterize the cloud of thoughts that belong to me in a specific time, to confront and develop myself as well as share them. Secondly, the resources we access on the internet can be lost over time or for other reasons by the service providers. Therefore I wanted to create an environment essay library/repository for backing up articles or works that I have found valuable on the internet by benefiting from the idea of hyperlinking.

In the future, I am planning to share, and document ideas, problems, artwork, and comments here. I hope it would be an interesting, inspiring, questioning, or enjoyable experience. Thank you for reading.

_data.text:
<!-- --- -->

This is neither my first blog nor the first time I am writing this particular text. Yet it is the first time that I am managing through my own interface. I have some sort of obsession with re-making/wording things I have done before. I have been amazed by the creativity of human beings, as a result of this, I always wanted to create things myself as well. Unfortunately, most of the time I lost in the process. Thus I have some sort of reasoning to backtrace my mistakes and sculpt them to better.

Lately, I have completed my master's thesis. I have the same concerns that I have mentioned before, I have worked and learned a lot and I have had to pin down what I have gained from the process. Firstly, I noticed that I like writing, and how important writing is in rendering and evaluating ideas. Secondly the difference between generating and representing ideas in a way to transpose a resonance on other minds. One of my problems (and I often see on other people too) is being lost in the process. I see that writing is one of the fastest and most convenient ways to concretize and convey ideas to evaluate or tinker at a later point. It could either work as external memory, along with managing the knowledge and memories. Therefore, I consider writing is one of the mediums through that I could develop myself, produce, and contribute to humankind. This is one of the reasons that I aimed to elaborate on why I have started this blog. 

This blog has a few objectives, one is, as I have told before to rasterize the cloud of thoughts that belong to me in a specific time, to confront and develop myself as well as share them. Secondly, the resources we access on the internet can be lost over time or for other reasons by the service providers. Therefore I wanted to create an environment essay library/repository for backing up articles or works that I have found valuable on the internet by benefiting from the idea of hyperlinking. 

In the future, I am planning to share, and document ideas, problems, artwork, and comments here. I hope it would be an interesting, inspiring, questioning, or enjoyable experience. Thank you for reading.

_data.text: | Created | Revision | Version | | :-- | :-- | :-- | | 18-Apr-2023 | 18-Jul-2023 | 1.3 | This is my self citation notation. I required to create this documents since I could not find both reliable syntactically coherent and citation guide. - Citation might fully grammatical syntactic but might take long time to write and looks ugly. - Citation might be elegant but consist of a lot of exceptions and problematic cases. - Some aspect considered, consistency, readability, extensibility and aesthetics. Aim of this study to mix a set elegant and systatic citation setup that includes vast range of sources without question marks. - referenc entry - footnote - in-text reference ## Types of Citation Three types of citation is held in this work these are - **In-text citation [WIP]** : Most compact form of citation. Not favored due to preventation of readability. However it is convenient on some cases. - **Footnote/ Endnote citation [WIP]** : Often contains explanation or specific information (ex. page in book) - **Bibliography citation** : Contains full information about to source ## Semantics 1. Citation gives minimum three of five **metadata information** about the source: - **Who**: Who has created the work? - **What**: What is the name of work? - **Where**: If it is published where? - **When**: When it is published or settled as frozen entity in history? - **How**: How do we reach it? Access link / doi etc. - The question why could be answered within the text or in footnotes but it is not a part of citation. - ex. Who. _What_. Where. When. How 2. One or information might be missing or not included. However, the order of the information is always the same and a citation should contain minimum 3 of the metadata information. - ex. Author. _Book_. Publisher. Date. 3. Each metadata information is separated and ended by . (dot) from each other except for **how**. - ex. Author. _Book_. Publisher. Date. 4. If the metadata is not conventional type: dissertation, book, article, newspaper. It should be indicated with square braces. - ex. [Video], [Podcast] 5. The source of the work is written italic. It might be a chapter of book, article in journal or a book itself. - ex. Author. _A Book_ . ... - ex. Author. "Article". In _Journal_. ... 7. Part of something relationships indicated through quotation marks. - ex. "Concept". In _Dictionary_. - ex. "Article" In _Journal_. 8. If the source name is in diffent language than article. The translation might be given in square braces after the name. - ex. Artikel [Article]. 9. Page numbers are categorical exception handled as how. comes after date with : separation. **Example Book Citation:** Arendt, Hannah. _The Human Condition_. _data.title: Code Standards

children.value: Use underscore(_) where you normally use whitespace( ).
if undescore is not available then the separator is dash(-)
if both underscore and dash are not available than the convention is camelCase
All lines limited to maximum of 91 Characters
On operations proper splits should be given for readability
Well known names shorted to 3-4 characters: libraries: libs
data                   (models, scenes, vertices, materials input in general)
mapping                 (how to associate data / mappings ex. shader with file names)
utililities            (self written library functions, parsers / calculators etc.)
For static third party library folders: version number attached via "-"
ex. util_shaders.cpp (file name if not in util folder)
well known constant names written uppercase
reasoning: Constants like PI = k_pi does not makes much sense and aesthetics.
Prepositions are not separated linked to left word
Each function has only one task
Constructors are exceptions, since class names start with upper-case
Class, struct members are not exceptions
code conventions for the java programming language

_data.text:
| Created       | Revision    | Version      |  
| :--           | :--         | :--          |
| 18-Apr-2023   | 02-Jun-2023 | 1.3          |

**Case Names**  
snake_case, PascalCase, camelCase, kebab-case, mixed_caseNaming 

**Todo**


## General Naming Rules
1. Favor 3-4 char abbreviations if readable
- ex. vertex        : vrtx
- ex. fragment      : frag
- ex. color         : col
- ex. lahmacun      : lah

2. Use underscore(_) where you normally use whitespace( ).
    1. if undescore is not available then the separator is dash(-)
    2. if both underscore and dash are not available than the convention is camelCase

## Formatting Conventions
1. **Maximum Line Length:** All lines limited to maximum of 91 Characters
    - https://peps.python.org/pep-0008/

2. imports are alone on rows.

3. On operations proper splits should be given for readability
    - ex. bad   : average=total/count;
    - ex. good  : average = total / count;

4. **Indentation** should follow 4 or 8 spaces.


## Classes, Structs
1. Always starts with a capital
2. Follows PascalCase
- ex. MyClass
- ex. ObjToDraw
- ex. ShaderCompileData

## Folders, Files
1. All small characters
    - ex. libs (folder name)
2. Well known names shorted to 3-4 characters: libraries: libs
3. File names could hold **prefix** or **abbreviated keywords** to sort related file together. 
    - **a / abst:** abstract data types    (structs / classes)
    - **d / data:** data                   (models, scenes, vertices, materials input in general)
    - **m / map:** mapping                 (how to associate data / mappings ex. shader with file names)
    - **c / core:** core                   (main file)
    - **u / util:** utililities            (self written library functions, parsers / calculators etc.)
    - **x / test:** testing                (test files)
3. For static third party library folders: version number attached via "-" 
    - ex. glm-0.9.9.8

- ex. util_shaders.cpp (file name if not in util folder)
- ex. shaders.cpp (an utility code if )

## Variables
1. variables use camel  
2. splits with underscore(_)
3. certain types marked with identifiers
    - **global              :** g_variable
    - **bools               :** b_variable
    - **constants           :** k_variable
    - **pointers            :** p_variable
    - **const char pointer  :** kp_variable_name
4. well known constant names written uppercase
    - reasoning: Constants like PI = k_pi does not makes much sense and aesthetics.
    - ex. PI, E
3. Prepositions are not separated linked to left word
- ex. sizeof_students, distanceto_next_prime


## Functions
1. Starts with a verb
2. clearly describes what function does
3. Each function has only one task
4. Starts with a small character
    - Constructors are exceptions, since class names start with upper-case
5. Follows camelCase()
6. Class, struct members are not exceptions
- ex. linkShaderProgram()
- ex. deleteCompiledShaders()

## Standards
|               |               |
|:--            | :--           |
| Phython       | pep-8
| php           | psr-2
| c             | nasa c-style guide
| general       | gnu coding standards
| java          | code conventions for the java programming language
| linux kernel  | https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/v4.10/process/coding-style.html

_data.title: What is the Architecture?

children.value: merhaba bu yazida isteyerek okudugum yapmaktan keyif aldigim ve urerken oldugunu dusundugum mimarlik meslegini neden biraktigimi ve mimarlik hakkindaki gorusudmun 15 yili askin bir surede nasil degistigini anlatacagim. Yazi hem kendimle olan bir yuzlesme hem de tecrubelrimi paylasma amaci tasimaktadir.

Mimarlik meslegini srcmemdeki nedenlar aslinda naifti. Icinde oturdugumuz beton yiginlarindan igreniyor obur tarafta film ve oyunlarda insanin hayal gucunun nelere kadir oldugunu gosteren olaganustu mekanlar goruyordum. Icinde oturdugumuz mekanlardan daha iyilerini yapip topluma katki saglayabilecegimi dusunuyor obur taraftan da mimarligi su anki yerlesik sanat episteminde estetik gorunen bir uretim yaratmanin otesinde matematik ve bilim kullanarak gerceklige izdusumu olabilecek bir sanat olarak goruyordum.
Okula girdikten sonra cok uzun bir sure her ne kadar egitim methoslari hakkinda guclu elestirilerim olsa da meslegin uygunlugu konusunda bir tereddutum olmadi.

Ogrenim surecinde bariz bir fark beni rahatsiz ediyordu. Estetik yoksunu ve depresif beton bloklarin icinde oturuyorduk. Obur tarafta insanlar hobbiteki gibi adeta cenneti andiran mekanlar yaratma kapasitesine vakifti. Benim iyi mimarlik anlayisim o zaman naif bir sekilde, kompleks bir form icerieinde cozumler ureterek bir hayat sekillendirebilme durumuyla dogru orantiliydi.

Okulda onumuze sunulan ornekler genelde yirminci yuzyil sonrasini kapsiyordu. Ilk basta modernist ikonlar olarak sunulan Le Corbusier, Mies van der Rohe gibi isimlerin ne ima ettigini anlayamamistim. Urettikleri mimari gunumuzdeki cogulculuk uzerinden bakildiginda dusunmesi oldukca basit ve yalin geliyordu. Bu noktaya daha sonradan deginecegim.

Daha yakin tarihe geldigimizde ise Zaha Hadid ve Frank gehry gibi isimler onumuze ornek alinacak insanlar olarak sunulmustu. Baslangicta bunu cok elestirel bir gozle degerlendirmeden kabul etmistim. Saygi duyuyordum cunku varolmayan daha onceden gormedigimiz bir seyi gorece bir estetik icerisinde adeta bir heykelmiscesine sunabiliyorlardi. Bu figurler ayni zamanda konvnsiyonel enstitulerin odullendirdigi ve iyi mimarlik bi diye isaret ettigi uretımı gerceklestıren ınsanlardi (bkz. Pritzker price, agahan mimarlik odulu).
Fakat zamanla bu gercekle baska bir olgu uzerinden yuzlestim.

Sinema ve oyunlar icin uretim yapan concept artistler, benzer form bulma islemini sadece estetik olarak cozmekle kalmiyor bu yapiyi, urettikleri yapili cevre icerisine siritmayacak sekilde yerlestirebiliyorlardi. Yeni parametreleri gormeye baslamsitim. Basta mimarligin heykeltraslik olmadigi ve ic mekan cozumlerinin de onem arz ettigi fikrine tutunsam da, ayni sanatcilarin detay cizimlerini inceledigimde sadece kabugu degil ic mekanlari da cozumlediklerini gormeye basladim. Artik konsept sanatcilar benim gozumde mimarlardan daha ust bir noktaya evrilmisti. Cunku onlardan cok daha nitelikli uretim yapmalarina ragmen, ne uretimlerinin karsiligini alabilyorlar ne de yapili cevrede soz haklari vardi.

Bu sirada mimarlik ogrenimimde ilerliyor, her seferinde benim yaptigim uretime eklenmesi gereken daha cok parametreyle karsilasiyordum. Baslangicta bir ev icerisindeki mahremiyet iliskilerini duzenlerken. ikinci projemde bir zanaatkar atolyesi hazirlamistim. Mahremiyet seviyelerinin uzerine, doga etkilesimi, isik gibi gorunen parametrelerin yanisira, cogunlukla cozden kacip adlandirmadigimiz daha once varolmayan bir gercekligi yaratma, hayati daha keyifli ve anlamli kilmaya yarayacak yeni adimlari burada gormeye baslamistim.

Sonraki projelerde artik, ozelden kamu ve yari gecirgen yapilara gectigimizde. Ilk defa bir yorumlama ile tanistim. Proje konumuz geregi yaptigimiz oyuncak muzesinde Daniel Libeskind in yahudi muzesi bir arastirma konusu olarak onumuzde duruyordu. Bu bir sergileme mekani olarak sunulan muzeden oldukca farkli bir calismaydi. Hic bilgisi olamayan biri olarak baktigimda yapiyi itici ve rahatsiz edici olarak tanimlamistim. Fakat, bir soykirim muzesi olarak tasarlanan bu yapinin tam olarak da amaci buydu. Yapiyi gezen insanlar sadece tarihteki objeleri donuk olarak gorup bilgilenmeyecek, ayrica muzenin aktarmaya calistigi tarihi immersive olarak deneyimleyecekti. Fikrin basarili veya basarisiz olmasindan bagimsiz olarak
basin tarafindan cok da goz onunde bulundurulamayan ancak yine de entellektuel bir karakter olarak saygi gormw sansina erismis tafuri gibi karakterle tanistim
insanlara baska, daha guzel bir hayatin mumkun oldugunu gosterme amacini tasir.
gelisimi faktorlerini topluma gosterme ve yansitma

Mimarligin ne oldugu konusudnaki tanimi yeniden ve yeniden yapmam gerekiyordu. Bunca yillik egitimde ne oldugunu hala anlayadin mi diye sorabilirsiniz. Fakat mimarlik fakultesinde profesorler doktora ogrnecileri yapicilar tasarimcilar kuramcilar modelciler kime sorarsaniz farkli bir cevap alacaginiza eminim bir noktaya kadar bu normal ve beklenen bir durum. Cunku sosyoloji gibi soyutlanmamis bilim dallarinin problem alanlari cok genistir. Temel bilimlerdeki gibi kesin formulize edilmis ifadelerle konusmak mumkun degildir. Problemi bir denklem olarak dusunursek icine giten parametre sayisi o kadar farkli ve degiskendir ki butun etkilesimleri net bir kesilikte ifade etmek imkansizdie. bkz. chaos theoey. O yuzden ki bir baska kompleks bilim olan ekonomide ceteris paribus adinda sikca kullanilan bir deyim vardir. Diger buyun parametrelerin sabit kaldigi varsamiyla kisitli sayidaki degiskenin birbirine olan etkisini ifade etmek icin kullanilir.

Mimarligi da benzer sekilde cok kompleks bir bilim olarak duusnebilirsiniz. Yaptiginiz mimarlik sosyoloji ekonomi, matematik fizik, kultur hemen her seyi kapsayabilir. Bu denli karmasik bir yapiyi degerlendirmesi de bir o kadar zordur. Iyi mimari nedir, iyi mimar kimdir sorularinin cevaplarini aksiyomik bir kesinlikte cevaplamak mumkun degildir. Bu tamamen sizin tanimlari nasil yaptiginiz ve hangi girdileri hangi agirlikta degerli gordugunuzle ilgilidir.
Bu noktada bize iyi mimarlik olarak satilan mimari once neoliberal soylem araciligiyla toplum algisina islenir. Daha sonra sekillenen toplum algisinda populist soylemlerle yuceltilir.
Ote taraftan iyi mimarinin nasil olmasi gerektigindeki onermeler nedensellikle mesruiyet kazanabilir.

Slogan problemi, bir onerme genis kapsamli bir seyi cok kisa sekilde ozetleyebilielr. Fakat slogan o kadar basittir ve o kadar genise hitap eder ki, cogunlukla ifade ettigi kavram uzerine cok dusunulmez veya anlamini yitirir veya cok boyutlulugunu yitirir.
how i developed project by project
Mimarlik sistem varolmauani gelistirme yebi bir yasam olasiligi onerme, yemekhane her yerde mutfak problem.
what is the problem with bim?
Mimar denilen paraya hizemt eden bir tekniker konumuna dusuyoe
Luks olmaktan ileri gidemeyecek pahali renderlar
Isim fetisismine dusmus emek somurusu yapilan teknikerler
bize minimum ve kisitli alanlari sunuyor her sey discrete minimum
why production of arch and education wrong
Arch critic dersi eski projeni al neyi sevmedigini bul
nereye ne yaptiniginizdan ziyade insanalr onemli
dolayisiyla insanlari egitir daha duyarli hale getirirseniz mekan ve ortsm guzellesir
fakst mekanin insanlari yonlendirme potansiyeli var dolayisiyla mekani bir ogretici olarka kullanabiliriz
04-Jan-2024 13.59-14.52       giris yazmaya basladim. Bazi gorselleri belirledim. Platformu portfoloyya kaldim
06-Dec-2023 16.42-17.28       discord ve google docs uzerindeki statementlari topladim.

Yazi hem kendimle olan bir yuzlesme hem de tecrubelrimi paylasma amaci tasimaktadir. Mimarlik meslegini srcmemdeki nedenlar aslinda naifti. Icinde oturdugumuz beton yiginlarindan igreniyor obur tarafta film ve oyunlarda insanin hayal gucunun nelere kadir oldugunu gosteren olaganustu mekanlar goruyordum. Icinde oturdugumuz mekanlardan daha iyilerini yapip topluma katki saglayabilecegimi dusunuyor obur taraftan da mimarligi su anki yerlesik sanat episteminde estetik gorunen bir uretim yaratmanin otesinde matematik ve bilim kullanarak gerceklige izdusumu olabilecek bir sanat olarak goruyordum. Okula girdikten sonra cok uzun bir sure her ne kadar egitim methoslari hakkinda guclu elestirilerim olsa da meslegin uygunlugu konusunda bir tereddutum olmadi. Ogrenim surecinde bariz bir fark beni rahatsiz ediyordu. Estetik yoksunu ve depresif beton bloklarin icinde oturuyorduk. _data.title: Archrist WoW Addon

children.value: Archrist is a versatile assistance addon designed for the Wrath of the Lich King expansion pack in World of Warcraft. This project integrates a diverse range of functionalities to enhance the gaming experience, created through drawing inspiration and code inspection from well-established addons like ElvUI, WeakAuras, Spy, and others.

Organizes and categorizes people in your group (raid or party) based on their specs into four main roles: tank, healer, mdps, rdps. This helps in tracking healer's mana, creating interrupt or Aura Mastery queues for better group synchronization.
Tracks important group spells in your party and displays them in a simple frame for easy reference.
Filters out greed loots for a cleaner chat frame.
Reminds you to check your posture at intervals.
Retrieves crafting guides from warcrafttavern.com. Calculates estimated material cost for your profession leveling, adapted to your current level. Shows you what to craft next.
An experimental feature that allows you to create and edit your own guides. However, it's not yet fully implemented.

Allows you to take notes about people and grade them with five main quantitative categories. Notes and grades are displayed upon mouseover. If you have a negative grade for someone, it warns you when they are in the same group with you.
A simple todo list that allows you to create notes to be checked out or completed at another time.
A single-click macro to select either flying or ground mount of your preference.
A level-adjusted single-click disenchanting macro that disenchants every item in your backpack within a given item range.

_data.text:
Archrist is a versatile assistance addon designed for the Wrath of the Lich King expansion pack in World of Warcraft. This project integrates a diverse range of functionalities to enhance the gaming experience, created through drawing inspiration and code inspection from well-established addons like ElvUI, WeakAuras, Spy, and others. **Tech Stack** **`Lua`** **`Ace3`** **Features** - **Assistance** - **Group Organizer** Organizes and categorizes people in your group (raid or party) based on their specs into four main roles: tank, healer, mdps, rdps. This helps in tracking healer's mana, creating interrupt or Aura Mastery queues for better group synchronization. - **Cooldown Tracker** Tracks important group spells in your party and displays them in a simple frame for easy reference. - **Utility** - **Loot Filter** Filters out greed loots for a cleaner chat frame. - **Posture Check** Reminds you to check your posture at intervals. - **Guide** - **Crafting Guides** Retrieves crafting guides from warcrafttavern.com. Calculates estimated material cost for your profession leveling, adapted to your current level. Shows you what to craft next. - **Guide Maker** An experimental feature that allows you to create and edit your own guides. However, it's not yet fully implemented. - **External Memory** - **Player Database** Allows you to take notes about people and grade them with five main quantitative categories. Notes and grades are displayed upon mouseover. If you have a negative grade for someone, it warns you when they are in the same group with you. - **Todo List** A simple todo list that allows you to create notes to be checked out or completed at another time. - **Extended Macros** - **Auto Mount** A single-click macro to select either flying or ground mount of your preference. - **Auto Disenchant** A level-adjusted single-click disenchanting macro that disenchants every item in your backpack within a given item range. **Display** | | | |:--: | :--: | |

_data.title: Attercop Web Scraper

children.value: A small chromium-based web scraper designed to automate the systematic retrieval of diverse data types, including text, tabular information, and visual content from the internet. Its primary purpose is to facilitate the extraction of reference materials relevant to traditional drawing practices.
The project is structured, incorporating Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) principles, notably emphasizing the implementation of key design patterns such as the
. These concepts enhance the modularity and extensibility of the codebase, contributing to a robust and maintainable solution.

Central to its functionality are various adaptors crafted to interface well-known platforms such as Pinterest, Artstation, and Github. Each adaptor is engineered to seamlessly interact with the specific structure and content presentation of its respective website, ensuring optimal data retrieval efficiency.

_data.text:
A small chromium-based web scraper designed to automate the systematic retrieval of diverse data types, including text, tabular information, and visual content from the internet. Its primary purpose is to facilitate the extraction of reference materials relevant to traditional drawing practices.

The project is structured, incorporating Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) principles, notably emphasizing the implementation of key design patterns such as the _Factory pattern_ and application of _polymorphism_. These concepts enhance the modularity and extensibility of the codebase, contributing to a robust and maintainable solution.

Central to its functionality are various adaptors crafted to interface well-known platforms such as Pinterest, Artstation, and Github. Each adaptor is engineered to seamlessly interact with the specific structure and content presentation of its respective website, ensuring optimal data retrieval efficiency.

**Tech Stack**
**`Python`** **`selenium`**

_data.title: Experimental Data Mapping Projects

children.value: During the Fall semester of 2019-20, I participated in a highly productive media course led by Professor Dr. Pelin Yoncaci Arslan. The course focused on graph theory, data, and information mapping theories and techniques, aligning them with the field of media studies.
I engaged in collaboration for two distinct projects aimed at experimentally mapping and relating information and data.
First Project: "The City as a Medium" by Friedrich Kittler (1996)

The task involved mapping the complex article by Friedrich Kittler, which creatively intertwined various theories and methods from different fields. Our approach was to categorize the content into headers, people, places, concepts, events, objects, and analogies. We sought to emulate Kittler's method of creatively describing and linking these elements. The visualization of these connections was executed using an interactive graph system originally designed for Alysii PI (Planetary Interactions), utilized for visualizing complex industry production processes in the virtual game EVE Online.
Second Project: Aikaterini Laskaradis Foundation Archive (1420-1919)

In this project, we aimed to map an archive comprising over 4000 drawings created by various travelers between 1420 and 1919. These visual materials were classified into 13 categories, allowing for one visual to exist in multiple categories. Utilizing a semi-analog filter, we rendered this information on a web interface. This interface enabled users to filter visuals based on years, observe production trends over time, and directly access specific visuals.
Both websites stemming from these projects are currently active and accessible for use.

_data.text:

Our approach was to categorize the content into headers, people, places, concepts, events, objects, and analogies. We sought to emulate Kittler's method of creatively describing and linking these elements. The visualization of these connections was executed using an interactive graph system originally designed for Alysii PI (Planetary Interactions), utilized for visualizing complex industry production processes in the virtual game EVE Online. **Second Project: Aikaterini Laskaradis Foundation Archive (1420-1919)** In this project, we aimed to map an archive comprising over 4000 drawings created by various travelers between 1420 and 1919. These visual materials were classified into 13 categories, allowing for one visual to exist in multiple categories. Utilizing a semi-analog filter, we rendered this information on a web interface. _data.title: Cauldron Cooking CRUD

children.value: Cauldron is a compact CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) cooking learning side project designed to represent cooking recipes through three essential metadata components: ingredients, tools, and steps. Primarily crafted as a submodule for potential integration into a broader nutrition database project, Cauldron serves as a practical exercise to enhance web development skills, focusing on a decoupled front-end and back-end architecture to facilitate compatibility with diverse interfaces.
Create, delete, retrieve, and update recipe data, ensuring efficient management of culinary information.
Retrieve nutrition values for selected recipes, providing users with essential dietary insights.

Implement a recommendation system based on filtering criteria such as tools, ingredients, tags (e.g., vegan, seafood), required time, and difficulty. Enhancing user experience by suggesting relevant recipes.
Integrate basic 3D models using three.js to animate and visualize cooking steps, offering a unique and interactive learning approach during the cooking phase.
Establish a connection to a database, ensuring data persistence and scalability for future expansion and integration into larger projects.

_data.text: Cauldron is a compact CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) cooking learning side project designed to represent cooking recipes through three essential metadata components: ingredients, tools, and steps. Primarily crafted as a submodule for potential integration into a broader nutrition database project, Cauldron serves as a practical exercise to enhance web development skills, focusing on a decoupled front-end and back-end architecture to facilitate compatibility with diverse interfaces. # Planned features - [x] Recipe Management - Create, delete, retrieve, and update recipe data, ensuring efficient management of culinary information. - [ ] Nutritional Information: - Retrieve nutrition values for selected recipes, providing users with essential dietary insights. - [ ] Recipe Recommendations: - Implement a recommendation system based on filtering criteria such as tools, ingredients, tags (e.g., vegan, seafood), required time, and difficulty. Enhancing user experience by suggesting relevant recipes. - [ ] Visual Learning Experience: - Integrate basic 3D models using three.js to animate and visualize cooking steps, offering a unique and interactive learning approach during the cooking phase. - [ ] Database Connectivity: - Establish a connection to a database, ensuring data persistence and scalability for future expansion and integration into larger projects. **Tech Stack** **`Python`** **`Javascript`** **`Flask`** **`HTML/CSS`** **`three.js`** # Display

_data.text:
In 2016, as Discord became my preferred platform for informal communication. Afterwards, I initiated a programming project to extend my use of Discord a simple bot for reminders, notes-taking, and a dictionary purposes. Over time, it evolved into a tool for organizing virtual events. This project taught me the importance of robust architecture, templating, documentation as well as logging and debugging. I practiced command handling, achieved modularity by templates, categories for commands. I delved into _synchronous_ and _asynchronous_ communication concepts. Despite its flaws, this project marks my first successful attempt at practical programming that solving a real problem. The invitation link and help function could be seen below, unfortunately, the bot is not online due to hosting problems. **Tech Stack** **`discord.js`** **`node.js`** **`Javascript`**

_data.title: OpenGL 3D Renderer

children.value: I developed a 3D renderer project to study computer graphics. In the process, I learned to integrate different C++ libraries into my project. I wrote my own 4x4 Matrix and 2/3/4-dimensional Vector libraries and arithmetic operation functions. The project involved using linear algebra for perspective projection and applying various computer graphics techniques like face culling, blending, and depth-stencil testing. Overall, my OpenGL 3D renderer project represents hands-on experience in computer graphics concepts.

_data.text:
I developed a 3D renderer project to study computer graphics. In the process, I learned to integrate different C++ libraries into my project. I wrote my own 4x4 Matrix and 2/3/4-dimensional Vector libraries and arithmetic operation functions. The project involved using linear algebra for perspective projection and applying various computer graphics techniques like face culling, blending, and depth-stencil testing. _data.title: Game Design Proposals

children.value: Dichotomy is a turn-based competitive board/strategy game that could be played between 2 to 6 players in which players make choices at each step, taking into account the behavior of the other players. To win the game, good strategy with the factor of luck must be present together. The game can be played at different difficulty levels depending on the preference of the player group.
The game draft is in the hypothetical phase. As it has not been tested, it may contain unforeseen logical problems or imbalanced cases.

The game space is created through combining hexagonal cards (module or dichotomy cards) to form a big hexagon form (map or board). Dichotomy cards are arranged randomly on the hexagonal game map. This condition introduces the factor of luck and creates an slightly different variation for each game. Map size is adjusted to include 13 module cards on the diagonal. Each session is aimed to last between 25-40 minutes to avoid the game becoming repetitive and overwhelming.
Each player starts on a corner of the hexagonal map. Players' positions relative to each other are positioned so that they are uniformly distributed across the game board.

Each player starts the game with five basic stats. These are Health, Hunger, Stamina, Strength and Speed.  Dichotomy cards show the player's position on the map. Only one player can be on a card at a time. Rotating on clockwise, players move by choosing one of the cards adjacent to their current dichotomy card. Each dichotomy card gives one negative and one positive property, e.g. +1 speed, -1 hunger.  Players have stats that affected by dichotomy cards.
Allows to player endure bad conditions if reaches zero, player dies.
Decreases one on each step if reaches zero player dies.
Power of player to handle encounters. Either against card or players.
Decreases one on each step. If zero player must one turn to gain.
Determines how many tiles player could move at once.

Each player gets a player card that has slot for cardriges of each stat. As player moves on the dichotomy card, one applies the stat changes on their card by giving/taking color distincted stat cardridges. Player cannot fill more than maximum amount of the stat. Each player should explicitly show their stat cards to other players.
Figure 4: Player Sheet and Stat Cartridges
The game can be won in more in various ways
By eliminating all the other players
Reaching the safe zone in the middle
By visiting 3 players starting place and acquiring their spawnstones.
are step-over decisions that affects player stats. It contains minimum 3 basic information. These are: name of the card, positive aspect, and negative aspect.

There are three groups of dichotomy cards distinguished by color.  These groups are there to prevent players from moving around the map with uniform ease, and to create some alignment rules to prevent randomization from creating cul de sac situations that players lose at the early game. In other words, randomization is intended to introduce the factor of luck into the game, whereas alignment rules are there to prevent chance of being the dominant factor and overriding the player's decisions.

The card the player steps on is flipped over and grayed out. This card loses its effect until the player exits the adjacent cards. At the end of each round the non-adjacent cards are reactivated. In order to win the game, the player needs to create a progressive strategy by balancing their stats on the maps and reading the actions of the other players.
Variations of dichotomy card is to be added considering the balance to extend the complexity of game.

Player could attack and kill other players. To hit another player, target player should be in the attack range by the player. Attacking another player costs 1 hunger and energy equal to players strength. If attacker players energy lesser than his/her strength, then player hit strength is regarded equivalent to as his/her stamina. Hit amount is decreased from attacked player's health. If it the health of attacked player reaches zero. Attacked player dies and attacker takes the position of attacked player, otherwise positions stays same.
There are certain single-use items added on the map with some rules. That enhances the stats extensively beyond limits, or provides unique abiltiy
Players have a technology tree and materials among map to create items in complexity level 2.
the killed player reborns on starting zone. Loses his collected spawnstones
In a post-apocalyptic world, there is scarce of sources to accommodate all. Survivalists compete against each other against each other to live.

holds the subtle message of this game. One of the principles that I have adopted in the late stage of my life as I have learned through experience. I encounter often the falsification about the perception of the concept of decision. As it to be regarded something to gain but at the same time not to lose. A decision, choosing one of the two or more options. It opens up a new path, but it also means that other paths are closed. It might seem about a cruel reality. Yet it bear an austere elegance and beauty because decisions are the mere qualities of character that describes who we are. Accepting the responsibility of two-sided condition of a decision not only make us more mature but progress as a being. As a result, the game aimed to express the statement in an entertaining way.

Swapfold is a single player origami puzzle/storyline-rpg mix top-down platformer game with a unique fundamental feature. Players must replicate actions on real world in order to find some solutions to puzzles. The main idea of the game to establishing a ground to show that games has potential as an environment to be a platform of education. On the completition of the game player should be able to learn few origami pieces through the method of associative learning.
Figure 1: Basic level origamis selected for each chapter

# Story
Our player is an apprentice mage who has to train portals. His supervisor gives him extraordinary tasks to complete. In order to understand how interdimensionality works you should be able to accurately represent and simulate them in simple dimensions. Idea comes from quartenions. So he/she starts to learn to play with simple tasks. However, during one of his tasks something goes wrong and a portal opens to demonic world of caridia. Now our characters needs to focus on his training to overcome this problem.    
Story | Draft | Hidden Test 
not: burayi yeniden yaz story pek iyi degil.

Gameplay starts with a simple platformer game with moving around and exploring the world. With a simple mixed combat and puzzle feature for complex spells. Like a cookbook analogy in programming our character learns simple unitary modular folding techniques to create simple origami pieces, each of which associated with a power word, that could be used combine and casts spells ingame.  This techniques progresss further on a skill tree. It is aimed that the skill tree also resembles what player learned in real life as well. On each chapter player requires to create an origami piece. Writing a mark on number on each fold. At the end opening crafted origami piece on 2D reveals a map on how to solve a puzzle in game.

Each power word is associated with a folding technique. Player uses keyboard shortcuts to cast power words. Spells are usually combination of (usually 3 or 4) few power words. In RPG combat player must cast spells. A complex set of power words represent portals as well as origami pieces.
Each power word is learned through a simple puzzle.
Figure 2: Fold and Power Word Asssociation on Skill Tree
Basic game mechanics is a adjusted combination of two main mechanics. Those are moderate paced, environmentally interactive top-down RPG game play and puzzle solving.
Each spell is combination of one or more power words. During RPG combat, player uses the combination of power words through
to cast spell to overcome challenges. This combinations further helps player to solve puzzles through replicating origami pieces in real life.
Example systems in real games (Ultima Online, Skyrim, Magicka).
Casting a spell requires a small amount of time. Each cast process has three periods. Those are:
states represents a failing cast. If player ends casts too early, spell fizzles, simply fails without any effect. After the end of fizzle,
period begins. During success, effect of spell increases exponantially until until excession period. The latest stage of the cast is
state is guaranteed failing cast and harms the player depending on the combination of spells. The harm is maximum at start and decreases parabolically up to half of maximum success effect.
Figure 3: Spell Effect Change In Relation To Cast Periods

On the combinations, different power words affect the cast time and proportions of the cast periods. Along with the mastery and usage frequency of the player.
Through the mix of spell word combination and progressive casting, it is aimed to create create precision input button combos, fun to play but hard to master base combat mechanics of the game.

Player requires to solve a puzzle a to unlock, final chapter battles in game. A typical puzzle is again combination of power words, ingredients or keys to be used on certain sequence or places. This sequence is revealed through creating an origami piece through instructions explored in sub-chapters. On each fold player writes a power word on paper in real world. After completing and unfolding the origami piece, map for solving the puzzle is revealed. The sequence of instructions, and words are randomized to create unique map for each instance of the game.
Game consist of chapters each chapters corresponds an origami piece, and chapters consists of sub-chapters each of one corresponds to fold-technique.

During sub-chapter with different hints player learns origami by retrieving knowledge such as which fold-technique to be used, how many times and where. Player could replicate this information step to create origami piece.
On certain steps, player are given some additional power words (as runes) for portal keys. On this case, the given rune needs to be written on  indicated area before applying the fold.

Completing the chapter, will result to complete the origami as well. However, to unlock next chapter, player requires to handle a boss fight. The boss fight room always resembles the unfolded paper of origami piece. On certain periods, boss stops and an area is indicated by color or light. On this time player should go to given area and cast the passing power word in given time.
If player had replicated given fold techniques in real life, unfolding the origami should reveal the true power words, in that player could use true power word to cast the portal.
Upon completing successful RPG boss fight with the combination of origami puzzle player defeats the boss and gains access to the new chapter. Along with learning an origami in real life.
Description selected origami for the chapter as a composition of folding steps.
Decision on which steps to write a power rune on fold.
Writing of appropriate questline for each fold and rune to reveal map.
Design of boss fight mechanics and space that bears resemblance of unfolded origami.

As a general principle, it is aimed to increase the interaction with the environment for player. Environment is not only frozen entity to move and orient for next encounter but also, something to be aware of and act depending of the requirements of the place. Player should be able to change, alter or impact on the environment. At the same time strategicaly use it for personal progression.
Frost based spells has multipliers to hit greater to wet enemies.
Player should avoid using fire spells on environment with dry woods to create fire.
Player should position themselves tactically to avoid impact boulder rolls, and even use this phenomenon to encounter with enemies.

One of the problems that I have encountered in online games, that crafted objects costs lesser than material itself. Which is often wrong compared to the real world. The problem is gathering costs labor, however crafting does not, as a result since the material has variety of usage it worth more. To compete with this problem. It is aimed to set alternative progression mechanics such as crafting to be supported by engraved mini games to include and value them in labor. On further extreme, who whole complex game could be considered as a composition of mini games too.
Lockpicking mechanism in Elder Scrolls series.

The mechanic requirements to solve puzzles or progression is aimed to be engraved in-game as much as possible. Player should not progress with grind with frozen state of mind, but immerse him/herself in the game content and try to solve a problem to make a progress.
Trolls could be killed by using fire spells learned through a book (Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, 2011)

On crafting, player must adjust the necessary conditions to create best possible variations of weapon. This information could be retrieved from someone, or something from ingame. To avoid duplication of the solution outside of the game. Given sources are randomized every game. On example, to forge a good sword, player should set the temperature to correct level. The level is described as a color of something (for instance a peach) ingame by someone or some text. Player should get a peach to compare colors to see correct level adjustment.

Another factor to establish an immersive environment is to push player to think and theorycraft the problem space created in-game. To create this environment, I consider, technology, and skill trees are good method to create complexity and considering people to think over variances and new possibilities to play and interract with the game. However, I belive skills trees should not shadow the players control over the character. Fundamental success should still be binded to player.

A time system tracks day/night cycles and calendar to set events. To bind sense of time to certain events such as puzzles or social/unique events ingame that enhances to create more surrounding environment in parallelity with the idea of Gesamkunstwerk.

As a fundamental aspect of any role-playing game inventory system is aimed to include in Swapfold. To be able to progress on character, use of materials to create more powerful objects and increase environmental interaction.

Describing environment as modules and computationally bind this parts to describe seamlessly transitive places. The idea is to create relatively unique experience on each seed, as well as preventing the rote progression.
Example games using described system: Diablo series, Valheim, Don't Starve
Map randomization: As a part of prodecural environment creation parts of the map is randomly customized
Puzzle randomization: To prevent same written guide to pass the game without playing it. The fold hints are given randomly to form a unique form for each puzzle instance.
Basic level origamis selected for each chapter. Figure produced by the author. 2023.
Fold and Power Word Asssociation on Skill Tree. Figure produced by the author. 2023.
Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Power Words
Spell Effect Change In Relation To Cast Periods. Figure produced by the author. 2023.
Periods of Cast Bar. Figure produced by the author. 2023.

## Dichotomy Board Game Dichotomy is a turn-based competitive board/strategy game that could be played between 2 to 6 players in which players make choices at each step, taking into account the behavior of the other players. To win the game, good strategy with the factor of luck must be present together. The game can be played at different difficulty levels depending on the preference of the player group. __Disclaimer:__ The game draft is in the hypothetical phase. As it has not been tested, it may contain unforeseen logical problems or imbalanced cases. # Setup The game space is created through combining hexagonal cards (module or dichotomy cards) to form a big hexagon form (map or board). Dichotomy cards are arranged randomly on the hexagonal game map. This condition introduces the factor of luck and creates an slightly different variation for each game. Map size is adjusted to include 13 module cards on the diagonal. Each session is aimed to last between 25-40 minutes to avoid the game becoming repetitive and overwhelming. ![Game Board](/nuxt_content/dichotomies/gameboard.png)
Figure 1: Gameboard
Each player starts on a corner of the hexagonal map. Players' positions relative to each other are positioned so that they are uniformly distributed across the game board. ![Player Placement](/nuxt_content/dichotomies/player_placement.png)
Figure 2: Player Placement
# Mechanics Each player starts the game with five basic stats. These are Health, Hunger, Stamina, Strength and Speed. Dichotomy cards show the player's position on the map. Only one player can be on a card at a time. Rotating on clockwise, players move by choosing one of the cards adjacent to their current dichotomy card. Each dichotomy card gives one negative and one positive property, e.g. +1 speed, -1 hunger. Players have stats that affected by dichotomy cards. | Icon | Stat | Limit |Description | |-----------------|-------------------------|-------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | ![health](/nuxt_content/dichotomies/icons/health.png) | Heal | 6 | Allows to player endure bad conditions if reaches zero, player dies. | | ![hunger](/nuxt_content/dichotomies/icons/hunger.png) | Hunger | 6 | Decreases one on each step if reaches zero player dies. | | ![strength](/nuxt_content/dichotomies/icons/strength.png) | Strength | 4 | Power of player to handle encounters. Either against card or players. | | ![stamina](/nuxt_content/dichotomies/icons/stamina.png) | Stamina | 4 | Decreases one on each step. If zero player must one turn to gain. | | ![speed](/nuxt_content/dichotomies/icons/speed.png) | Speed | 3 | Determines how many tiles player could move at once. |
Table 1: Player Stats
![Player Movement](/nuxt_content/dichotomies/player_movement.png)
Figure 3: Player Movement
__Tracking player stats__ Each player gets a player card that has slot for cardriges of each stat. As player moves on the dichotomy card, one applies the stat changes on their card by giving/taking color distincted stat cardridges. Player cannot fill more than maximum amount of the stat. Each player should explicitly show their stat cards to other players. ![Player Sheet and Cartridges](/nuxt_content/dichotomies/player_sheet.png)
Figure 4: Player Sheet and Stat Cartridges
__The game can be won in more in various ways__ - By eliminating all the other players - Reaching the safe zone in the middle - By visiting 3 players starting place and acquiring their spawnstones. __Dichotomy Cards__ are step-over decisions that affects player stats. It contains minimum 3 basic information. These are: name of the card, positive aspect, and negative aspect. __Dichotomy Card Levels__ There are three groups of dichotomy cards distinguished by color. These groups are there to prevent players from moving around the map with uniform ease, and to create some alignment rules to prevent randomization from creating cul de sac situations that players lose at the early game. In other words, randomization is intended to introduce the factor of luck into the game, whereas alignment rules are there to prevent chance of being the dominant factor and overriding the player's decisions. | Color | Level | Desciption | |------------------|--------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | Green | Easy | Regular trade-off | | Yellow | Medium | Unfair trade-off | | Orange | Hard | Extremely unfair trade-off | __Step over preventation__ The card the player steps on is flipped over and grayed out. This card loses its effect until the player exits the adjacent cards. At the end of each round the non-adjacent cards are reactivated. In order to win the game, the player needs to create a progressive strategy by balancing their stats on the maps and reading the actions of the other players. ![Dichotomy Card](/nuxt_content/dichotomies/dichotomy_card.png)
Figure 5: Dichotomy card (Back and Front)
__Dichotomy Card Examples__ | Name | Positive Aspect | Negative Aspect | |------------------|--------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | Hunt | +1 Hunger | -1 Stamina | | Stay | +1 Energy | -1 Hunger, No movement | | Training | +1 Strength | -1 Stamina, -1 Hunger | | Teleport | -2 Energy, -1 Speed | Move to desired location | | Portal | -1 Energy, -1 Hunger | Move to designated location (other portal) | | ... | ... | ... | - Variations of dichotomy card is to be added considering the balance to extend the complexity of game. __Player versus Player__ Player could attack and kill other players. To hit another player, target player should be in the attack range by the player. Attacking another player costs 1 hunger and energy equal to players strength. If attacker players energy lesser than his/her strength, then player hit strength is regarded equivalent to as his/her stamina. Hit amount is decreased from attacked player's health. If it the health of attacked player reaches zero. Attacked player dies and attacker takes the position of attacked player, otherwise positions stays same. # Modes and Variations - **Complexity Level 1:** - There are certain single-use items added on the map with some rules. That enhances the stats extensively beyond limits, or provides unique abiltiy - ex. bow, bicycle etc. - **Complexity Level 2:** - Players have a technology tree and materials among map to create items in complexity level 2. - ex. Research cooking, weapon craft - **Immortal mode:** - the killed player reborns on starting zone. Loses his collected spawnstones # Story In a post-apocalyptic world, there is scarce of sources to accommodate all. Survivalists compete against each other against each other to live. # Theory The statement _decisions comes with trade-offs_ holds the subtle message of this game. One of the principles that I have adopted in the late stage of my life as I have learned through experience. I encounter often the falsification about the perception of the concept of decision. As it to be regarded something to gain but at the same time not to lose. A decision, choosing one of the two or more options. It opens up a new path, but it also means that other paths are closed. It might seem about a cruel reality. Yet it bear an austere elegance and beauty because decisions are the mere qualities of character that describes who we are. Accepting the responsibility of two-sided condition of a decision not only make us more mature but progress as a being. As a result, the game aimed to express the statement in an entertaining way. # References and Credits __Visual References__ 1. All figures in the article produced by the author. 2. Example systems in real games (Ultima Online, Skyrim, Magicka). __Progressive Casting__ Casting a spell requires a small amount of time. Each cast process has three periods. Those are: _fizzle_, _success_, _excession_. With the analogy of cooking, _fizzle_ states represents a failing cast. If player ends casts too early, spell fizzles, simply fails without any effect. After the end of fizzle, _success_ period begins. During success, effect of spell increases exponantially until until excession period. The latest stage of the cast is _excession_ period. _Excession_ state is guaranteed failing cast and harms the player depending on the combination of spells. The harm is maximum at start and decreases parabolically up to half of maximum success effect. ![Player Placement](/nuxt_content/swapfold/cast_graph.png)
Figure 3: Spell Effect Change In Relation To Cast Periods
On the combinations, different power words affect the cast time and proportions of the cast periods. Along with the mastery and usage frequency of the player. Through the mix of spell word combination and progressive casting, it is aimed to create create precision input button combos, fun to play but hard to master base combat mechanics of the game. ![Player Placement](/nuxt_content/swapfold/cast_bar.png)
Figure 4: Periods of Cast Bar
__Real World Replication__ Player requires to solve a puzzle a to unlock, final chapter battles in game. A typical puzzle is again combination of power words, ingredients or keys to be used on certain sequence or places. This sequence is revealed through creating an origami piece through instructions explored in sub-chapters. On each fold player writes a power word on paper in real world. After completing and unfolding the origami piece, map for solving the puzzle is revealed. The sequence of instructions, and words are randomized to create unique map for each instance of the game. __Example Puzzle Chapter__ - Game consist of chapters each chapters corresponds an origami piece, and chapters consists of sub-chapters each of one corresponds to fold-technique. - During sub-chapter with different hints player learns origami by retrieving knowledge such as which fold-technique to be used, how many times and where. Player could replicate this information step to create origami piece. - On certain steps, player are given some additional power words (as runes) for portal keys. On this case, the given rune needs to be written on indicated area before applying the fold. - Completing the chapter, will result to complete the origami as well. However, to unlock next chapter, player requires to handle a boss fight. The boss fight room always resembles the unfolded paper of origami piece. On certain periods, boss stops and an area is indicated by color or light. On this time player should go to given area and cast the passing power word in given time. - If player had replicated given fold techniques in real life, unfolding the origami should reveal the true power words, in that player could use true power word to cast the portal. - Upon completing successful RPG boss fight with the combination of origami puzzle player defeats the boss and gains access to the new chapter. Along with learning an origami in real life. ![Player Placement](/nuxt_content/swapfold/mapping.png)
Figure 5: Puzzle Solving Steps Depiction
__Puzzle Generation Steps__ 1. Description selected origami for the chapter as a composition of folding steps. 2. Decision on which steps to write a power rune on fold. 3. Writing of appropriate questline for each fold and rune to reveal map. 4. Design of boss fight mechanics and space that bears resemblance of unfolded origami. # Theory __Environmental Interactions__ As a general principle, it is aimed to increase the interaction with the environment for player. Environment is not only frozen entity to move and orient for next encounter but also, something to be aware of and act depending of the requirements of the place. Player should be able to change, alter or impact on the environment. At the same time strategicaly use it for personal progression. Example cases: - Frost based spells has multipliers to hit greater to wet enemies. - Player should avoid using fire spells on environment with dry woods to create fire. - Player should position themselves tactically to avoid impact boulder rolls, and even use this phenomenon to encounter with enemies. __Integrated Mini Games__ One of the problems that I have encountered in online games, that crafted objects costs lesser than material itself. Which is often wrong compared to the real world. The problem is gathering costs labor, however crafting does not, as a result since the material has variety of usage it worth more. To compete with this problem. It is aimed to set alternative progression mechanics such as crafting to be supported by engraved mini games to include and value them in labor. On further extreme, who whole complex game could be considered as a composition of mini games too. Example cases: - Progressive casting mechanism given above. - Lockpicking mechanism in Elder Scrolls series. - Hacking in Eve Online. __Internal Learning Mechanism__ The mechanic requirements to solve puzzles or progression is aimed to be engraved in-game as much as possible. Player should not progress with grind with frozen state of mind, but immerse him/herself in the game content and try to solve a problem to make a progress. Example casees: - Trolls could be killed by using fire spells learned through a book (Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, 2011) - On crafting, player must adjust the necessary conditions to create best possible variations of weapon. This information could be retrieved from someone, or something from ingame. To avoid duplication of the solution outside of the game. Given sources are randomized every game. On example, to forge a good sword, player should set the temperature to correct level. The level is described as a color of something (for instance a peach) ingame by someone or some text. Player should get a peach to compare colors to see correct level adjustment. __Technology and Skill Trees__ Another factor to establish an immersive environment is to push player to think and theorycraft the problem space created in-game. To create this environment, I consider, technology, and skill trees are good method to create complexity and considering people to think over variances and new possibilities to play and interract with the game. However, I belive skills trees should not shadow the players control over the character. Fundamental success should still be binded to player. # Sub Systems __Time and Date__ A time system tracks day/night cycles and calendar to set events. To bind sense of time to certain events such as puzzles or social/unique events ingame that enhances to create more surrounding environment in parallelity with the idea of Gesamkunstwerk. __Inventory__ As a fundamental aspect of any role-playing game inventory system is aimed to include in Swapfold. To be able to progress on character, use of materials to create more powerful objects and increase environmental interaction. __Procedural Environment Generation__ Describing environment as modules and computationally bind this parts to describe seamlessly transitive places. The idea is to create relatively unique experience on each seed, as well as preventing the rote progression. - Example games using described system: Diablo series, Valheim, Don't Starve __Controlled Randomization__ - Map randomization: As a part of prodecural environment creation parts of the map is randomly customized - Puzzle randomization: To prevent same written guide to pass the game without playing it. The fold hints are given randomly to form a unique form for each puzzle instance. # References and Credits __Visual References__ 1. _Figure 1._ Basic level origamis selected for each chapter. Figure produced by the author. 2023. - Sampled From: _Twitter: The Art of Origami_. 2020. Accessed (10-Feb-2023) https://twitter.com/PaperFolding101/status/1249763477394161664 2. _Figure 2._ Fold and Power Word Asssociation on Skill Tree. Figure produced by the author. 2023. - Sampled From: _Ultima Online Spellbook_. n.d. Accessed (14-Feb-2023) https://runuo.theabyss.ru/images/uokr/sitecontent/skill/mysticism/mystbook.jpg - Sampled From: _Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Power Words_. 2011. Accessed (14-Feb-2023) https://i.ytimg.com/vi/xBqg1N1taEk/maxresdefault.jpg - Sampled From: _Elder Futhark_ n.d. Accessed (13-Feb-2023) https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/57/Anglosaxonrunes.svg/1024px-Anglosaxonrunes.svg.png 3. _Figure 3._ Spell Effect Change In Relation To Cast Periods. Figure produced by the author. 2023. 4. _Figure 4._ Periods of Cast Bar. Figure produced by the author. 2023. 5. _Figure 5._ Puzzle Solving Steps Depiction. Figure produced by the author. 2023. __Used Sources__ 1. 3Blue1Brown. _Visualizing quaternions (4d numbers) with stereographic projection_. Youtube [Video File]. 2018. Accessed (12-Nov-2021) https://youtu.be/d4EgbgTm0Bgquartenions 2. "Camera Obscura". _In Wikipedia_. n.d. Accessed (25-Feb-2023) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camera_obscura 3. "Chekhov's Gun". _In Wikipedia_. n.d. Accessed (25-Feb-2023) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chekhov%27s_gun 4. DevDungeon. _The Cookbook Method of Learning Programming Languages_. ## Quest Writing on Ultima Online I have written some questlines in Turkish speaking custom Ultima Online servers in the timeline of 2015-2016. Few of them are implemented in-game however stories are shortened to great extend. There are some visuals from implemented ingame content.

Ingame Screenshot from Quest "Dog of the Cook"

Ingame Screenshot from Quest "Lora's Sheep" - Inventory

Ingame Screenshot from Quest "Lora's Sheep" - World
__Example quests that I have written:__ - https://www.worldofuo.com/ascinin-kopegi.html - https://www.worldofuo.com/hircin-ruth.html - https://www.worldofuo.com/loranin-koyunu.html ## Data Mapping Projects I have worked on different groups mapping projects through conceptional inquiries on the subject such as data, knowledge, notation, mapping and representation during very enjoyable and fruitful 2019 Fall semester in Architectural History ad Digital Humanities Lab conducted by Prof. Dr. Pelin Yoncacı Arslan. During the course we have attempted to discover various ways of communication, and transformation between mediums. We have conducted experimental knowledge mapping projects through an article by Friedrich Kittler (1996) and and Travelogues database by Aikaterini Laskaridis Foundation, mainly by using _graph theory_ by Leonhard Euler and various techniques.

Mapping of Friedrich Kittler's "City is a Medium"
__Mapping Friedrich Kittler. The City is a Medium:__ https://voidnode.github.io/ __Mapping Travelogues:__ https://seozugur.github.io/AH516/ ## Previous Game Design Attempts I've constantly made short and experimental attempts in different branches of the game development industry, but unfortunately, many of my projects have been abandoned. Below you can see some of my modeling, rigging and animation work in Blender and some of my experiments in the Unity game engine.

Running Animation of Rigged Low Poly Wolf

UI Prototype by Combining Elements from Various Games

Rig Tests in Unity with Move Script

I was often imitating the works of Ilya Kuvshinov, Adam Adamowicz, Samwise Didier and many other artists I admire. Except imaginative comprehension studies, none of the studies are belong to me intellectually but I drawed them to study.

Digital Anatomy Studies (Not Original)

_data.title: Technical Works

children.value: my first well organized programming project was a maze solver that I have created in 2022. I trained a programming concepts, skills to feel comfortable on the development and simple software architecture to set interface and communicate with the user.
This project is completed by using a tutorial on console level, then UI is implemented though using TKInter library by python and MVP software architecture.
More detailed information about the project and documentation could be accessed from the link below.

On next level I have made a clone version of well known breakout game. I have familiarized myself in Unity game engine tools. And wanted to finish a game from start to end, in most basic version, with menu, UI elements and playable level.

Aim of the game was to be able to famialirize with gaming engines and process of creating a game from start to finish. During the development, I have simulated the base game logic, set up conditions for win and lose, a basic user interface and practiced software architecture patterns to solve certain problems.

This is my first project on an actual game. I have developed my own addon on World of Warcaft that has many functions mainly helps to organizational tasks and raid control. Again I have trained various computer architecture I have isolated my modules from each other to create protected variations, and communicate between modules. in this project I have also used various libraries to build my interface. Learned to read structed documentation created by other people and use it in my own project.

After completing my first project I wanted to deep dive into more complex game that households subsystems such as inventory, day/light, crafting, skill-trees and growing objects, looting, building etc. To work, I have started to learn repertoire of functilities on 2D TopDown rpg clone. I seek solutions for how to create world by creating and using tile palette. How to put player character and make it move. How to implement inventory system, etc.
RPG Clone Inventory Drag and Drop
RPG Clone Item Stacking and Pick up Test
RPG Clone Inventory System: World Item Drop

In order to achieve unique artstyle in-games, I have attempted to write my own shaders to simulate weather, light interactions and reflections. Through simulating a pixel art / cel shader on 3D game with camera aligned 2D elements. Below you can see my shader writing attempts. However, they are still primitive.
Custom Shader Test: Using Scene Light for Dynamic Shading
